description: Example prompts for ObjectiveFrame structural engineering code generator

categories.name: Basic Structures
categories.description: Simple frames and grids for learning and testing

examples.name: Simple Rectangular Frame
examples.prompt: Create a simple rectangular frame that is 10 meters wide, 8 meters deep, and 6 meters tall.

examples.name: Cubic Frame
examples.prompt: Generate a cubic frame structure with 5 meter sides.

examples.name: Braced Building Frame
examples.prompt: Make a rectangular building frame: 15m wide, 20m deep, 12m tall, with diagonal bracing on two opposite faces.

examples.name: Ground Grid
examples.prompt: Create a flat grid structure at ground level, 20x20 meters, with 4 divisions in each direction.

examples.name: Roof Grid
examples.prompt: Generate a roof grid that is 30 meters wide and 40 meters long at 5 meters height, divided into 6x8 panels.

categories.name: Bridges
categories.description: Various bridge types including arch, truss, and suspension designs

examples.name: Parabolic Arch Bridge
examples.prompt: Design a parabolic arch bridge spanning 50 meters with a rise of 10 meters and a deck width of 8 meters. Include vertical spandrel columns every 5 meters connecting the arch to a deck 2 meters above the arch peak.

examples.name: Semi-Circular Arch Bridge
examples.prompt: Create a semi-circular arch bridge with a 30 meter span, 12 meter rise, and 6 meter width. Add cross-bracing every 10 segments.

examples.name: Three-Hinged Arch Bridge
examples.prompt: Generate a three-hinged arch bridge spanning 80 meters with a rise of 16 meters. Use a parabolic curve and include the deck structure.

examples.name: Warren Truss Bridge
examples.prompt: Design a Warren truss bridge spanning 60 meters with a truss depth of 6 meters. Use 12 panels and make it 10 meters wide.

examples.name: Pratt Truss Bridge
examples.prompt: Create a Pratt truss bridge 40 meters long, 5 meters tall, with vertical members at supports and alternating diagonal web members. Make it 8 meters wide.

examples.name: Double-Deck Truss Bridge
examples.prompt: Generate a double-deck truss bridge: 100m span, 12m depth, 15m wide, with the upper deck for vehicles and lower deck for trains.

examples.name: Simple Suspension Bridge
examples.prompt: Design a simple suspension bridge with two towers 80 meters apart, each 30 meters tall. Include a main catenary cable with a sag of 8 meters and vertical hangers every 4 meters supporting a deck at 5 meters above ground.

examples.name: Cable-Stayed Bridge
examples.prompt: Create a cable-stayed bridge with two towers 50 meters apart, towers 40m tall, and fan-pattern cables connecting to a deck 100 meters long and 12 meters wide.

categories.name: Buildings
categories.description: Building structures from low-rise to skyscrapers

examples.name: 3-Story Office Building
examples.prompt: Generate a 3-story office building frame: 24m wide, 30m deep, each floor 4m tall. Include perimeter columns and floor grids with 6m spacing.

examples.name: Single-Story Warehouse
examples.prompt: Create a single-story warehouse structure: 40m x 60m footprint, 8m height, with a grid of columns at 10m intervals and roof trusses.

examples.name: 2-Story Residential Building
examples.prompt: Design a 2-story residential building: 12m x 16m, ground floor 3.5m tall, second floor 3m tall, with simple rectangular frames.

examples.name: 10-Story Building with Core
examples.prompt: Generate a 10-story building: 30m x 40m footprint, 3.5m floor height. Include perimeter frame, central core (8m x 12m), and X-bracing on two faces.

examples.name: 15-Story Office Tower
examples.prompt: Create a 15-story office tower: 25m x 25m, 4m per floor, with corner columns, edge beams at each floor, and diagonal bracing every 5 floors.

examples.name: 30-Story Skyscraper
examples.prompt: Design a 30-story skyscraper with a 40m x 40m footprint, 3.8m floor heights, tube-in-tube structure with perimeter columns every 5m and a central 15m x 15m core. Add outrigger trusses at floors 10, 20, and 30.

examples.name: 50-Story Tapered Tower
examples.prompt: Generate a 50-story tapered tower: base 50m x 50m, top 30m x 30m, 4m floor heights. Include bundled tube structure and mega-bracing every 10 floors.

categories.name: Towers
categories.description: Lattice towers, transmission towers, and observation structures

examples.name: Transmission Tower
examples.prompt: Create a 60-meter tall transmission tower with a square cross-section, 10m wide at base, tapering to 4m at top. Use X-bracing in each panel and 6-meter panel heights.

examples.name: Triangular Lattice Tower
examples.prompt: Design a triangular lattice tower: 40m tall, 8m base width, 3m top width, with diagonal bracing in a zig-zag pattern.

examples.name: Telecommunication Tower
examples.prompt: Generate a 100m telecommunication tower with square section, 15m base, 5m top, divided into 10 sections with progressive tapering.

examples.name: Eiffel-Style Tower
examples.prompt: Create an Eiffel-style observation tower: 80m tall, 40m square base tapering to 10m square at top, with 3 viewing platforms at 25m, 50m, and 75m heights.

examples.name: Modern Observation Tower
examples.prompt: Design a modern observation tower with four corner legs, 50m tall, 20m square base, 8m top, with a viewing platform at 45m height.

categories.name: Domes & Shells
categories.description: Curved structures including domes, shells, and vaults

examples.name: Geodesic Dome
examples.prompt: Generate a geodesic dome with 20-meter radius, using 16 meridians and 8 latitude rings.

examples.name: Ribbed Dome
examples.prompt: Create a ribbed dome: 30m radius, with 24 radial ribs and 6 horizontal ring beams at equal vertical intervals.

examples.name: Lattice Dome
examples.prompt: Design a lattice dome, 25m diameter at base, with triangular facets for a geodesic pattern. Use frequency 3 subdivision.

examples.name: Barrel Vault
examples.prompt: Create a barrel vault structure: 20m span, 40m length, 8m rise, with arched ribs every 4 meters and horizontal purlins connecting them.

examples.name: Hyperbolic Paraboloid Shell
examples.prompt: Generate a hyperbolic paraboloid shell: 30m x 30m base, 15m height at corners, with a grid pattern following the surface curvature.

categories.name: Space Frames
categories.description: Three-dimensional truss systems for roofs and large spans

examples.name: Double-Layer Space Frame
examples.prompt: Design a double-layer space frame: 40m x 40m, with bottom layer at ground level, top layer at 3m height. Use a square-on-square offset pattern with 4m grid spacing.

examples.name: Flat Space Truss Roof
examples.prompt: Create a flat space truss roof: 60m x 80m, 4m deep, with top and bottom chords in a 5m grid pattern and diagonal web members.

examples.name: Barrel Vault Space Frame
examples.prompt: Generate a barrel vault space frame: 30m span, 50m length, 12m rise, using a double-layer triangulated grid following the curved surface.

categories.name: Specialized Structures
categories.description: Stadium roofs, industrial structures, and agricultural buildings

examples.name: Cantilever Stadium Roof
examples.prompt: Create a cantilever stadium roof: rectangular 80m x 120m with one long edge supported and the opposite edge cantilevering 40m. Use deep trusses every 10m along the supported edge.

examples.name: Dome Stadium Roof
examples.prompt: Design a dome stadium roof covering a 100m diameter circle, with a central oculus of 20m diameter. Use radial trusses and ring beams.

examples.name: Crane Gantry
examples.prompt: Generate a crane gantry structure: 30m span, 12m height, 60m length, with rails on top beams and X-braced portal frames every 10m.

examples.name: Cooling Tower
examples.prompt: Create a cooling tower hyperboloid structure: 40m base diameter, 25m throat diameter at mid-height, 60m total height, 45m top diameter.

examples.name: Greenhouse Frame
examples.prompt: Design a greenhouse frame: 20m wide (arched roof), 50m long, 6m height at peak, with arched trusses every 5m.

examples.name: Grain Silo Support
examples.prompt: Create a grain silo support structure: circular array of 8 columns around a 12m diameter circle, 20m tall, with ring beams every 5m and diagonal bracing.

categories.name: Advanced & Complex
categories.description: Hybrid structures, parametric designs, and artistic concepts

examples.name: Cable-Stayed Arch Bridge
examples.prompt: Design a cable-stayed arch bridge: 120m span with a central arch (rise 20m) and cable stays from arch peak to deck every 6m. Deck at 8m height, 15m wide.

examples.name: Diagrid Tower
examples.prompt: Create a diagrid tower: 50m tall, 25m x 25m base, with diagonal grid pattern at 60-degree angles forming triangular modules. No vertical columns except at corners.

examples.name: Twisted Tower
examples.prompt: Generate a twisted tower: rectangular base 20m x 30m at ground, rotates 90 degrees over 80m height (10 floors, 8m each), maintaining same footprint dimensions.

examples.name: Branching Tree Structure
examples.prompt: Design a branching tree structure: single central column at base (2m x 2m), splitting into 4 branches at 10m height, each branch extending 15m further and spreading 8m from center.

examples.name: Mobius Strip
examples.prompt: Create a mobius strip structure: 30m outer diameter, 3m strip width, using triangulated beam elements following the twisted surface.

examples.name: Tensegrity Tower
examples.prompt: Design a tensegrity tower: 40m tall, using compression members (vertical and diagonal) and tension cables in a stacked module pattern. Each module 8m tall with 10m diameter.

difficulty_levels.intermediate: Moderate complexity with standard structural patterns
difficulty_levels.expert: Highly complex or innovative structural systems

tips: Always include key dimensions (width, depth, height, span)
Specify subdivision details (number of panels, segments, divisions)
Mention bracing patterns for clarity (X-bracing, Warren, Pratt)
Include member spacing when relevant (every 5m, at 10m intervals)
For curved structures, specify curve type (parabolic, circular, catenary)
